reviewText: This is the story about the aftermath following the collapse of the World Trade Towers in New York. It tells of the bravery, not only of those directly involved, but also of the families who had to wait for them to return with news. There are a few graphic descriptions of human remains and the effects that has on team members, but also the shock effect from being told that in many cases there were no remains; he extraordinary heat that caused the buildings to disintegrate removed the evidence of human occupancy. It is an insight into the true meaning of what it is to be a firefighter.

Very emotional movie on different fronts. The accounts of the aftermath of the 9-11 attacks are eye-opening and the bond between brothers, both the rescuers and the true brothers, is very real. Prepare to be saddened by the imagery. Must see for anyone interested with the events of 9-11.

Not much for this type of movie, however this one kept me interested. I never paused it or turned it off.  Very unusual for me.  Found it under Alan Rickman. For those interested in him:  it only has his voice at the begining.  That's it.  So if you are interested in 9/11 this one is great.  If not don't bother.
A deeply moving account of the affect of September 11th from a personal prospective, I enjoyed this film enormously.

an incredibly moving and compelling true account of a moment in time in the lives of two people profoundly and directly impacted by the events of september 11th.  it was engaging, riveting and a unique and distinctive portrayal of two brothers connected, yet disconnected.
